nodes.title: Breaking News: The New York attorney general Letitia James can question Donald Trump and two of his children in a civil inquiry into his business practices, a judge ruled, rejecting Trump's effort to block the questioning. https://t.co/dgCGpnYZvc

nodes.title: A 13-year-old girl was held in a juvenile-detention center for 11 days after a classmate impersonated her on social media to make threats against their school. Now, her family has filed a lawsuit against the school and Instagram for failing to protect her. https://t.co/RwxMVSpfwO

Harvard obtained her therapy notes and gave them to the professor, according to a lawsuit.
https://t.co/X58Uo6dx3v

nodes.title: Dennis Hope has spent 27 years alone in a Texas prison cell smaller than a compact parking space. Last month, he asked the Supreme Court to consider setting limits on prolonged isolation under the Eighth Amendment, which bars cruel and unusual punishments. https://t.co/OuUHz6IdYH https://t.co/xFWd6LMQMy

nodes.title: Novak Djokovic is prepared to miss the French Open, Wimbledon and other tennis tournaments if a Covid vaccine is required to compete, he said in a BBC interview. Being free to choose what goes in his body is â€œmore important than any title,â€ he said. https://t.co/QjkmSbO0yx
